lead_paragraph: The court has so far not resolved the issue of whether the principle means that voting districts should have the same number of people, or the same number of eligible voters.

headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Agrees to Settle ‘1 Person 1 Vote’
headline.main: Supreme Court Agrees to Settle Meaning of ‘One Person One Vote’

snippet: The court has so far not resolved the issue of whether the principle means that voting districts should have the same number of people, or the same number of eligible voters.
abstract: Supreme Court agrees to hear case over meaning of 'one person one vote,' with ruling having vast implications; court has never decided whether voting districts should have same number of people, or same number of eligible voters; ruling in favor of two Texas voters who brought case would move political power from cities to rural areas, aiding Republicans.
